%s went out; it\'s your final turn - did you remember to meld?

In this game you play 11 rounds against the computer and/or against other humans. The winner is the player who has the lowest score at the end of the game.

 You start with the round of 3's where you have 3 cards and 3's are wild (in addition to Jokers). You end with the round of Kings where you have 13 cards and Kings are wild.
 In each turn, draw from the Draw or Discard pile to your hand, meld your cards (by dragging them to the meld area on the screen), and discard a card to the Discard pile. Melds are 3 or more of the same rank, or 3 or more in a suit sequence, including as many wild cards as you like.

 A player is "out" when they have melded all their cards, giving them a score of 0 for the round. All other players get one more turn to improve their hands, or also go out. At the end of the round, your score for the round is the sum of the unmelded cards you have left. Cards count their face value except that unmelded wild cards count 20, and unmelded Jokers count 50 (so make sure to meld before you discard!)

 For example, to "go out" in the round of 3's you have to have a meld of 3 cards; in the round of 4's a meld of 4 cards; in round of 5's a meld of 5 cards (this is the hardest). 
 Starting in the round of 6's you can have 2 melds of 3 or a meld of 6, and it gets more flexible after that. When the Droid player goes out it will show you its hand and you can learn from what it does.

Five Kings is a card melding game. You play 11 rounds against the computer and/or against other humans. The winner is the player who has the lowest score at the end of the game.
 To play the first round, you tap the "Start Game" button, and then tap it again to play the 3's round.
 In the 3's round you are dealt 3 cards. To "go out" you have to make a meld of 3 cards. Melds are 3 or more cards of the same rank (for example, 3 Kings) or 3 of the same suit in a sequence (like 5-6-7 of spades).
 I'll start the 3's Round for you now."

The small cards represent You and other players (initially just the Droid player) and show your current score. When it\'s a player\'s turn the hand shakes. Tap the shaking hand to play it. If it\'s your hand (You) then you can decide what to do. I\'ll tap your hand to show you.

When it\'s your turn, your cards appear here. You get 3 cards in the 3\'s round, 4 cards in the 4\'s round and so on up to the King\'s round where you have 13 cards! To play your turn draw a card from the Draw pile or the Discard pile.
The Draw and Discard piles shake to show you can draw from them. Tap the Discard pile to draw the card that is showing there. Or if you don\'t think it helps your hand…
…you can tap the Draw pile and hope you are lucky! In the Five Kings deck there are two of each card from 3\'s to Kings, six Jokers, and an extra suit (lightning bolts).

To make melds, drag cards (one by one) to the meld area in the bottom row. You can add to an existing meld, or create a new one (by dragging into the dashed box). Melds are 3 or more of the same rank, or 3 or more in a suit sequence, including as many wild cards as you like. You can \"go out\" (finish the round) by melding all your cards. The other players get one more turn to improve their hands, or also go out.

Use your wild cards to help you meld (for example, 5 spades - Joker - 7 spades). The Jokers are always wild. In addition, in the 3\'s round all 3\'s are wild, in the 4\'s round all 4\'s are wild and so on. Wildcards are highlighted so you remember to use them properly.

To end you turn, drag one card you don\'t want to the Discard pile. Make sure you\'ve made any melds before discarding, especially on your final turn!\n Then tap the next player (the shaking hand) to play its turn. After your final turn, your score for the round is the sum of the unmelded cards you have left.\n The round score will show after you discard. Cards count their face value except that unmelded wild cards count 20, and unmelded Jokers count 50!

1. The Draw and Discard pile shake when you should draw from one of them.
 2. Make sure to meld (3 or more cards) before you discard! In the rounds of 3,4, and 5 you make only one meld, but in the King's round you could have 3 melds of 3 cards plus a meld of 4 cards.
 3. Jokers are wild, and so are 3's in the 3's round, 4's in the 4's round and so on. Wild cards are highlighted by default.
 4. Watch which of your discards the Droid player picks up to see what melds it is working on.
 5. After another player goes out, you get one more turn. If you can't meld a wild card, make sure you discard it!

 To help you get started, in the first two rounds I'll show the Droid cards and some special hints.
 To not show this tutorial next time, go to Settings>Show introduction and hints
